# World Development Indicators 2022

### Data Science Analysis  
World Bank WDI Dataset

---

# Dataset Overview

- Source: World Bank World Development Indicators  
- Year: 2022  
- 217 countries  
- 14 macroeconomic indicators  

---

# Indicators Examined

- GDP per capita  
- Life expectancy  
- Unemployment rate  

These capture:
- Economic performance  
- Health outcomes  
- Labor market conditions  

---

# GDP per Capita Summary

```{python}
import pandas as pd
df = pd.read_csv("wdi.csv")
df["gdp_per_capita"].describe()
```

- Highly skewed distribution  
- Large income inequality across countries  

---

# Life Expectancy Summary

```{python}
df["life_expectancy"].describe()
```

- More concentrated distribution  
- Still major cross-country variation  

---

# GDP vs Life Expectancy

```{python}
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

df_plot = df[["gdp_per_capita", "life_expectancy"]].dropna()

plt.figure()
plt.scatter(df_plot["gdp_per_capita"], df_plot["life_expectancy"])
plt.xlabel("GDP per capita (USD)")
plt.ylabel("Life Expectancy (years)")
plt.title("GDP vs Life Expectancy (2022)")
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()
```

- Positive association  
- Higher income â†’ higher life expectancy  

---

# Top 10 Countries by GDP per Capita

```{python}
top10 = df.sort_values("gdp_per_capita", ascending=False).head(10)

plt.figure()
plt.barh(top10["country"], top10["gdp_per_capita"])
plt.xlabel("GDP per capita (USD)")
plt.title("Top 10 GDP per Capita Countries (2022)")
plt.gca().invert_yaxis()
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()
```

- Significant disparities among high-income countries  

---

# Key Findings

- GDP per capita strongly correlates with life expectancy  
- Extreme inequality in income distribution  
- Labor markets vary substantially  

---

# Conclusion

Economic development is closely linked to health outcomes.

However, large disparities persist globally.
